Position: Mechanical/ Mechatronics Engineer

Organization: Wireless PnC Inc.

Duration: 8 months

Start date: May 1st 2025

Location: Victoria, BC (Hybrid Schedule)

Compensation: 3,020 gross cash for working 40 hours per week.

Company Description:

Wireless PnC Inc. is a cleantech company headquartered in Victoria, BC. We develop universal level two wireless charging stations to support the standardization of low-GHG emissions for Electric Vehicle charging units. Our solutions pose particular value for environmentally conscious individuals and corporations by reducing charging anxiety and increasing charging access to support the transition to clean transport. Our mission is to inspire a generation where "charging" is no longer seen as synonymous with "plugs" by improving access to fast and environmentally friendly wireless chargers applicable to all types, sizes, and brands of EVs.

Job Description:

Wireless PnC is seeking a passionate, innovative and strategic Mechanical or Mechatronics Engineer who can contribute to our project. This individual will be a key member of the Engineering Team and will support designing our first wireless charging station. The team member is expected to perform literature review, modeling and simulation, schematics and station design for macro mobility stations with wireless energy transmission. The team will work remotely under the supervision of our Research Manager.

The scope of the job duties are as follows:

Research on the station design
Designing and implementing macro mobility stations with modular wireless power transfer systems.
Develop the detailed design of wireless EV charging stations and associated electrical infrastructure.
Modeling and simulation
Close collaboration with university collaborators with the design and manufacturing of the charging station.
Close collaboration with the electrical engineering team to meet their needs
Collect information on operational performance, perform root-cause analysis of identified faults, and liaise with suppliers to fix them.
Maintain appropriate design documentation and use company-designated design guidelines and keep up to date with new standards in the automotive industry
Write validation test plans for all phases of the projects and support vehicle-level bench testing activities and report findings.
Develop a structured process to increase efficiency in the delivery of the above
objectives.

Academic Requirements:

Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related field.

Qualifications:

Technical knowledge of electric vehicle battery systems and charging technologies, methodologies, and controls.
Experience with CAD tools
Experience using simulation tools such as MATLAB/Simulink, LTSPICE, and programming tools such as Python, C, and C++.
Excellent troubleshooting skills to find the root cause and propose the best possible solution.
A good balance of structured/holistic thinking with fast-moving and pragmatic execution.
Passionate about continuous improvement, process efficiency, and collaboration.

Other Requirements

Being a Canadian Citizen, Permanent Resident or have refugee status is required as this position is grant-funded by the Canadian Government.

Contact

Please apply with your resume and transcript to pablo@wirelesspnc.com

We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are the foundation for innovation and is an integral part of our business. We believe that success happens where new ideas can flourish - in an inclusive environment that is rich in diversity and a place where people from various backgrounds can work together. As an equal-opportunity employer, Wireless Pnc Inc encourages applications from all qualified individuals, including candidates from underrepresented groups and communities. We invite all qualified candidates to apply online with their resume and transcript.
